name: monarch
interpret: n.帝王，君主，最高统治者
example: 单词 monarch 的例句||||The monarch's role is purely ceremonial. 君主纯粹是个礼仪职位。||||I think myself happier now than the greatest monarch upon earth. 我觉得这个时候比世界上什么帝王都快乐。

name: positively
interpret: adv.明确地，断然，坚决地；实在，确实
example: 单词 positively 的例句||||She was positively glowing with happiness. 她满脸幸福。||||The weather was positively poisonous. 这天气着实讨厌。

name: poultry
interpret: n.家禽，禽肉
example: 单词 poultry 的例句||||There is not much poultry in the shops. 商店里禽肉不太多。||||What do you feed the poultry on? 你们用什么饲料喂养家禽？

name: moss
interpret: n.苔，藓，地衣
example: 单词 moss 的例句||||Moss grows on a rock. 苔藓生在石头上。||||He was found asleep on a pillow of leaves and moss. 有人看见他枕着树叶和苔藓睡着了。

name: piston
interpret: n.活塞
example: 单词 piston 的例句||||They use a piston engine instead. 他们改用活塞发动机。||||The piston moves by steam pressure. 活塞在蒸汽压力下运动。

name: galaxy
interpret: n.星系；银河系；一群(杰出或著名的人物)
example: 单词 galaxy 的例句||||The earth is one of the planets in the Galaxy. 地球是银河系中的星球之一。||||The company has a galaxy of talent. 该公司拥有一批优秀的人才。

name: constrain
interpret: vt.限制，约束；克制，抑制
example: 单词 constrain 的例句||||She tried to constrain herself from a cough in class. 上课时她竭力忍住不咳嗽。||||The study will examine the factors which constrain local economic growth. 这项研究将考查抑制当地经济发展的因素。

name: collaboration
interpret: n.合作，协作；勾结
example: 单词 collaboration 的例句||||The two companies are working in close collaboration each other. 这两家公司密切合作。||||He was shot for collaboration with the enemy. 他因通敌而被枪毙了。

name: cynical
interpret: adj.(对人性或动机)怀疑的，不信世道向善的
example: 单词 cynical 的例句||||The enormous difficulty makes him cynical about the feasibility of the idea. 由于困难很大，他对这个主意是否可行持怀疑态度。||||He was cynical that any good could come of democracy. 他不相信民主会带来什么好处。

name: contemplate
interpret: vt.盘算，计议；周密考虑；注视，凝视
example: 单词 contemplate 的例句||||The possibility of war is too horrifying to contemplate. 战争的可能性太可怕了，真不堪细想。||||The consequences would be too ghastly to contemplate. 后果不堪设想。

name: evoke
interpret: vt.唤起，引起，使人想起
example: 单词 evoke 的例句||||These images are likely to evoke a strong response in the viewer. 这些图像可能会在观众中产生强烈反响。||||Her only resource was the sympathy she could evoke. 她可以凭借的唯一力量就是她能从人们心底里激起的同情。

name: exempt
interpret: adj.免除的；vt.使免除；n.免税者，被免除义务者
example: 单词 exempt 的例句||||These goods are exempt from customs duties. 这些货物免征关税。||||He is exempt from punishment about this thing. 关于此事对他已免于处分。

name: contrive
interpret: vt.谋划，策划；设法做到；设计，想出
example: 单词 contrive 的例句||||Can you contrive to be here a little earlier? 你能不能早一点来？||||How could you contrive to make such a mess of things? 你怎么把事情弄得一团糟呢？

name: discrepancy
interpret: n.不同；不符；差异；矛盾
example: 单词 discrepancy 的例句||||The discrepancy in their ages seemed not to matter. 他们之间年龄的差异似乎没有多大关系。||||There was a discrepancy in the two reports of the accident. 关于那次事故的两则报道有不一致之处。

name: discrete
interpret: adj.个别的，分离的，不连续的
example: 单词 discrete 的例句||||The picture consists of a lot of discrete spots of colour. 这幅画由许多不相连的色点组成。||||Most staple fibers are discrete, individual entities. 大多数短纤维是不联系的单独实体。

name: discriminate
interpret: vt.&vi.区别，辨别，区分；有区别地对待
example: 单词 discriminate 的例句||||You must learn to discriminate between facts and opinions. 你必须学会把事实和看法区分出来。||||They can discriminate hundreds of colours. 他们能分辨上百种颜色。

name: converge
interpret: vi.会合；聚集，集中；(思想、观点等)趋近
example: 单词 converge 的例句||||The results converge towards this truth. 其结果趋近于这个真理。||||Parallel lines converge at infinity. 平行线永不相交。

name: commute
interpret: vi.乘车上下班；vt.减(刑)；折合；n.上下班交通
example: 单词 commute 的例句||||I spend much less time on my commute to work now. 我现在工作的往返时间要节省好多。||||Most office workers commute from the suburbs. 很多公司的职员都是从郊外来上班的。

name: disposition
interpret: n.性情，性格；意向，倾向；排列，部署
example: 单词 disposition 的例句||||He has made a good disposition of his property. 他已对财产作了妥善处理。||||He has a cheerful disposition. 他性情开朗。

name: corps
interpret: n.(通信等兵种的)部队；(同类作的)一组
example: 单词 corps 的例句||||The medical corps were cited for bravery in combat. 医疗队由于在战场上的英勇表现而受嘉奖。||||When the war broke out, he volunteered for the Marine Corps. 战争爆发时，他自愿参加了海军陆战队。

name: corrode
interpret: vt.使腐蚀，侵蚀，破害；vi.腐蚀，被侵蚀
example: 单词 corrode 的例句||||The tools will corrode with rust if never used. 这些工具如长期不用会长铁锈而损坏。||||It will pollute people's aesthetic taste and corrode social spirit. 它污染人们的审美趣味，腐蚀社会精神。

name: distil
interpret: vt.蒸馏；提取…的精华，精选出
example: 单词 distil 的例句||||You can distil fresh water from the sea. 你可以用蒸馏法从海水中提取淡水。||||The writer managed to distil his ideas into one succinct article. 作家努力把他的想法浓缩成一篇简练的文章。

name: domain
interpret: n.(活动等)领域，范围；领地，势力范围
example: 单词 domain 的例句||||This information should be in the public domain. 这一消息应该为公众所知。||||This question comes into the domain of philosophy. 这一问题属于哲学范畴。

name: cumulative
interpret: adj.累积的，渐增的
example: 单词 cumulative 的例句||||This drug has a cumulative effect. 这种药有渐增的效力。||||The benefits from eating fish are cumulative. 吃鱼的好处要长期才能显现。

name: conscientious
interpret: adj.审慎正直的，认真的，本着良心的
example: 单词 conscientious 的例句||||He is a conscientious man and knows his job. 他很认真负责，也很懂行。||||He is very conscientious in the performance of his duties. 他非常认真地履行职责。

name: pretext
interpret: n.借口，托词
example: 单词 pretext 的例句||||He used his headache as a pretext for not going to school. 他借口头疼而不去上学。||||He didn't attend that meeting under the pretext of sickness. 他以生病为借口，没参加那个会议。

name: residential
interpret: adj.提供住宿的；居住的；住宅的
example: 单词 residential 的例句||||The mayor inspected the residential section of the city. 市长视察了该市的住宅区。||||The residential blocks were integrated with the rest of the college. 住宿区与学院其他部分结合在了一起。

name: resonance
interpret: n.洪亮；共鸣；共振
example: 单词 resonance 的例句||||Playing the piano sets up resonance in those glass ornaments. 一弹钢琴那些玻璃饰物就会产生共振。||||The areas under the two resonance envelopes are unequal. 两个共振峰下面的面积是不相等的。

name: retrieve
interpret: vt.重新得到，收回；挽回，补救；检索
example: 单词 retrieve 的例句||||He was determined to retrieve his honor. 他决心恢复名誉。||||The men were trying to retrieve weapons left when the army abandoned the island. 士兵们正试图找回军队从该岛撤退时留下的武器。

name: retrospect
interpret: n.回顾，追溯；vt.&vi.回顾，回想，追溯
example: 单词 retrospect 的例句||||One's school life seems happier in retrospect than in reality. 学校生活回忆起来显得比实际上要快乐。||||In retrospect, it's easy to see why we were wrong. 回顾过去就很容易明白我们的错处了。

name: prone
interpret: adj.(to)易于…的，很可能…的；俯卧的
example: 单词 prone 的例句||||Some people are prone to jump to hasty conclusions. 有些人往往作出轻率的结论。||||He is prone to lose his temper when people disagree with him. 人家一不同意他的意见，他就发脾气。

name: solitary
interpret: adj.孤独的，独立的，荒凉的；n.隐士
example: 单词 solitary 的例句||||I am rather fond of a solitary stroll in the country. 我颇喜欢在乡间独自徜徉。||||The castle rises in solitary splendour on the fringe of the desert. 这座城堡巍然耸立在沙漠的边际，显得十分壮美。

name: robust
interpret: adj.强壮的，强健的，粗野的，需要体力的，浓的
example: 单词 robust 的例句||||She is too tall and robust. 她个子太高，身体太壮。||||China wants to keep growth robust to reduce poverty and avoid job losses, AP commented. 美联社评论道，中国希望保持经济强势增长，以减少贫困和失业状况。

name: rupture
interpret: n.破裂；(关系的)决裂；vt.&vi.(使)破裂
example: 单词 rupture 的例句||||I can rupture a rule for a friend. 我可以为朋友破一次例。||||The rupture of a blood vessel usually causes the mark of a bruise. 血管的突然破裂往往会造成外伤的痕迹。

name: subsidy
interpret: n.补助金，津贴
example: 单词 subsidy 的例句||||The university will receive a subsidy for research in artificial intelligence. 那个大学将得到一笔人工智能研究的补助费。||||The living subsidy for senior expert's family is included in the remuneration. 报酬已包含高级专家家人的生活补贴。

name: spouse
interpret: n.配偶(指夫或妻)
example: 单词 spouse 的例句||||Her spouse will come to see her on Sunday. 她的丈夫星期天要来看她。||||What is the best way to keep your spouse happy in the marriage? 在婚姻中保持配偶幸福的最好方法是什么？

name: turnover
interpret: n.人员流动率，人事变动率；营业额，成交量
example: 单词 turnover 的例句||||The store greatly reduced the prices to make a quick turnover. 这家商店实行大减价以迅速周转资金。||||Our turnover actually increased last year. 去年我们的营业额竟然增加了。

name: stationary
interpret: adj.固定的，静止不动的
example: 单词 stationary 的例句||||A stationary object is easy to be aimed at. 一个静止不动的物体是容易瞄准的。||||Wait until the bus is stationary before you get off. 你要等公共汽车停稳了再下车。

name: susceptible
interpret: adj.过敏的，敏感的；易动感情的，易受感动的
example: 单词 susceptible 的例句||||Children are more susceptible than adults. 孩子比成人易受感动。||||We are all susceptible to advertising. 我们都易受广告的影响。

name: vapor
interpret: n.蒸汽，雾气
example: 单词 vapor 的例句||||The cold wind condenses vapor into rain. 冷风使水蒸气凝结成雨。||||This new machine sometimes transpires a lot of hot vapor. 这部机器有时排出大量的热气。

name: fulfill
interpret: vt.履行，实现，完成；满足，使满意
example: 单词 fulfill 的例句||||If you make a promise you should fulfill it. 如果你许诺了，你就要履行你的诺言。||||This company should be able to fulfill our requirements. 这家公司应该能够满足我们的要求。

name: offense
interpret: n.犯规，违法行为；冒犯，得罪
example: 单词 offense 的例句||||I hope you will not take any offense at my words. 对我讲的话请别见怪。||||His words gave great offense to everybody present. 他的发言冲犯了在场的所有人。

name: doctorate
interpret: n.(大学授予的)博士学位
example: 单词 doctorate 的例句||||He hasn't enough credits to get his doctorate. 他的学分不够取得博士学位。||||Where did she do her doctorate? 她在哪里攻读博士？

name: chilly
interpret: adj.凉快的，寒冷的
example: 单词 chilly 的例句||||I feel chilly without a coat. 我由于没有穿大衣而感到凉飕飕的。||||I grew chilly when the fire went out. 炉火熄灭后，寒气逼人。

name: strictly
interpret: adv.严厉地，严格地；严密地
example: 单词 strictly 的例句||||His doctor is dieting him strictly. 他的医生严格规定他的饮食。||||The guests were seated strictly in order of precedence. 客人严格按照地位高低就座。

name: reliability
interpret: n.可靠性，确实性
example: 单词 reliability 的例句||||We mustn't presume too much upon the reliability of such sources. 我们不应过分指望这类消息来源的可靠性。||||I can assure you of the reliability of the information. 我向你保证这消息可靠。

name: attentive
interpret: adj.注意的，专心的；关心(别人)的，殷勤的
example: 单词 attentive 的例句||||She was very attentive to her guests. 她对客人招待得十分周到。||||The speaker likes to have an attentive audience. 演讲者喜欢注意力集中的听众。

name: coupon
interpret: n.息票，配给票，附单
example: 单词 coupon 的例句||||The coupon can be used once only. 此优惠券只限使用一次。||||I have a coupon for ten pence off a packet of soap. 我有一张优惠券买一盒肥皂可以便宜十便士。

name: spine
interpret: n.脊柱，脊椎；(动植物的)刺；书脊
example: 单词 spine 的例句||||He broke his spine in a fall from a horse. 他从马上跌下摔断了脊梁骨。||||His spine developed a slight curve. 他的脊柱有点弯曲。

name: solitude
interpret: n. 孤独; 独居,荒僻之地,幽静的地方
example: 单词 solitude 的例句||||People need a chance to reflect on spiritual matters in solitude. 人们需要独处的机会来反思精神上的事情。||||They searched for a place where they could live in solitude. 他们寻找一个可以过隐居生活的地方。

name: opt
interpret: vi.选择，决定做某事
example: 单词 opt 的例句||||They opt for more holiday instead of more pay. 他们选择了延长假期而不是增加工资。||||Will individual schools be given the right to opt out of the local school authority? 各个学校可能有权选择退出地方教育局吗？

name: maturity
interpret: n.成熟；完成；(支票、债券等)到期
example: 单词 maturity 的例句||||These plants ought to reach maturity after five years. 这些植物五年后就该长成了。||||This is the period at which the body attains maturity. 这是身体发育成熟的时期。

name: infrastructure
interpret: n.下部构造，下部组织，基础结构，基础设施
example: 单词 infrastructure 的例句||||We should step up the development of infrastructure for research. 加强科学基础设施建设。||||We should strengthen cultural infrastructure and boost various types of popular culture. 加强文化基础设施建设，发展各类群众文化。

name: benign
interpret: adj.善良的，慈祥的；良性的，无危险的
example: 单词 benign 的例句||||The benign weather brought North America a bumper crop. 温和的气候给北美带来大丰收。||||Martha is a benign old lady. 玛莎是个仁慈的老妇人。

name: atmospheric
interpret: adj.大气的，空气的；大气层的；大气所引起的
example: 单词 atmospheric 的例句||||Sea surface temperatures and atmospheric circulation are strongly coupled. 海洋表面温度与大气环流是密切相关的。||||Clouds return radiant energy to the surface primarily via the atmospheric window. 云主要通过大气窗区向地表辐射能量。

name: marital
interpret: adj.婚姻的，夫妻的
example: 单词 marital 的例句||||Her son had no marital problems. 她的儿子没有婚姻问题。||||I regret getting involved with my daughter's marital problems. 我后悔干涉我女儿的婚姻问题。

name: auction
interpret: n.拍卖；拍卖会；vt.拍卖
example: 单词 auction 的例句||||They've put the contents of their house up for auction. 他们把房子里的东西全都拿去拍卖了。||||They bought a new minibus with the proceeds from the auction. 他们用拍卖得来的钱买了一辆新面包车。

name: streak
interpret: n.条理，斑纹，倾向，少许，痕迹；v.加条纹，变成条纹，奔驰，快速移动
example: 单词 streak 的例句||||The Indians used to streak their faces with paint. 印第安人过去常用颜料在脸上涂条纹。||||Why did you streak the tree? 你为什么在树上刻条纹？

name: bowel
interpret: n.肠(尤指人肠)；内部，深处
example: 单词 bowel 的例句||||Irritable bowel syndrome seems to affect more women than men. 女性比男性更易患肠易激综合征。|||| Have you had a bowel movement today? 你今天有排便吗？

name: lucrative
interpret: adj.赚钱的，可获利的
example: 单词 lucrative 的例句||||He decided to turn his hobby into a lucrative sideline. 他决定把自己的爱好变成赚钱的副业。|||| It was not a lucrative profession. 那是一个没有多少油水的职业。

name: scholastic
interpret: adj.学校的，学院的，学术上的
example: 单词 scholastic 的例句||||There was a careful avoidance of the sensitive topic in the scholastic circles. 学术界小心地避开那个敏感的话题。||||This would do harm to students' scholastic performance in the long run. 这将对学生未来的学习成绩有害。

name: deduct
interpret: vt.扣除，减去
example: 单词 deduct 的例句||||You can deduct the twenty-five cents out of my allowance. 你可在我的零用钱里扣去二角五分钱。|||| On condition of your signing this contract, I will deduct a percentage. 如果你在这份合同上签字，我就会给你减免一个百分比。

name: repression
interpret: n.镇压，抑制，抑压
example: 单词 repression 的例句||||The repression of your true feelings is harmful to your health. 压抑你的真实感情有害健康。||||This touched off a new storm against violent repression. 这引起了反对暴力镇压的新风暴。

name: lavish
interpret: adj.无节制的；浪费的；vt.慷慨地给予，挥霍
example: 单词 lavish 的例句||||He despised people who were lavish with their praises. 他看不起那些阿谀奉承的人。||||The sets and costumes are lavish. 布景和服装极尽奢华。

name: irresistible
interpret: adj.非常诱人的，无法拒绝的，无法抗拒的
example: 单词 irresistible 的例句||||The wheel of history rolls forward with an irresistible force. 历史车轮滚滚向前，势不可挡。||||She saw an irresistible skirt in the store window. 她看见商店的橱窗里有一条叫人着迷的裙子。

name: shear
interpret: n.修剪，剪下的东西，羊的一岁；vt.剪掉，割，剥夺；vi.修剪，切割，剥夺，穿越
example: 单词 shear 的例句||||Every spring they shear off the sheep's wool and sell it. 每年春天他们都要剪下羊毛去卖。||||In the Hebrides they shear their sheep later than anywhere else. 在赫伯里兹，剪羊毛的时间比其他任何地方都要晚。

name: cellular
interpret: adj.移动的；细胞的，由细胞组成的
example: 单词 cellular 的例句||||She has a cellular telephone in her car. 她的汽车里有一部无线通讯电话机。||||Many people use cellular materials as sensitive elements in hygrometers. 很多人用蜂窝状的材料作为测量湿度的传感元件。

name: administrator
interpret: n.经营管理者，行政官员
example: 单词 administrator 的例句||||The role of administrator absorbed much of Ben's energy. 行政职务耗掉本很多精力。||||He has proved himself capable as administrator. 他表现出管理才能。

name: escalate
interpret: vt.&vi.(使)逐步增长(或发展)，(使)逐步升级
example: 单词 escalate 的例句||||It would tempt Israel's neighbors to escalate their demands. 它将诱使以色列的邻国不断把他们的要求升级。||||Defeat could cause one side or other to escalate the conflict. 失败可能会导致其中一方将冲突升级。

name: slash
interpret: vi.大幅度削减；vt.猛砍，尖锐抨击，大幅减少；n.猛砍，斜线，长切口，衣衩
example: 单词 slash 的例句||||The shop plans to slash fur prices after Spring Festival. 该店计划在春节之后把皮货降价。||||Don't slash your horse in that cruel way. 不要那样残忍地鞭打你的马。

name: obsolete
interpret: adj.已废弃的，过时的
example: 单词 obsolete 的例句||||These goods are obsolete and will not fetch much on the market. 这些货品过时了，在市场上卖不了高价。||||They tried to hammer obsolete ideas into the young people's heads. 他们竭力把陈旧思想灌输给青年。

name: broker
interpret: n.中间人，经纪人；vt.作为中间人来安排；vi.作为权力经纪人进行谈判
example: 单词 broker 的例句||||He baited the broker by promises of higher commissions. 他答应给更高的佣金来引诱那位经纪人。|||| I'm a real estate broker. 我是不动产经纪人。

name: cognitive
interpret: adj.认知的，认识的，有感知的
example: 单词 cognitive 的例句||||As children grow older, their cognitive processes become sharper. 孩子们越长越大，他们的认知过程变得更为敏锐。||||The cognitive psychologist is like the tinker who wants to know how a clock works. 认知心理学者倒很像一个需要通晓钟表如何运转的钟表修理匠。

name: originality
interpret: n.创造力，独创性；新颖
example: 单词 originality 的例句||||The name of the game in pop music is originality. 流行音乐的本质是独创性。||||He displayed an originality amounting almost to genius. 他显示出近乎天才的创造性。

name: corruption
interpret: n.腐败，堕落，贪污
example: 单词 corruption 的例句||||The people asked the government to hit out against corruption and theft. 人民要求政府严惩贪污盗窃。||||The old man reviled against corruption. 那老人痛斥了贪污舞弊。

name: infrared
interpret: adj./n.红外线(的)
example: 单词 infrared 的例句||||Infrared is widely used in industry and medical science. 红外线广泛应用于工业和医学科学。||||Infrared radiation has wavelengths longer than those of visible light. 红外辐射的波长比可见光的波长长。

name: Fahrenheit
interpret: n./adj.华氏温度；华氏温度计(的)
example: 单词 Fahrenheit 的例句||||He was asked for the boiling point of water in Fahrenheit. 他被问到水的沸点是华氏多少度。||||The thermometer reads 80 degrees Fahrenheit. 寒暑表指出华氏80度。

name: corpse
interpret: n.尸体，死尸
example: 单词 corpse 的例句||||What she saw was just an unfeeling corpse. 她见到的只是一具全无感觉的尸体。||||The corpse was preserved from decay by embalming. 尸体用香料涂抹以防腐烂。

name: diplomacy
interpret: n.外交；外交手腕，交际手腕
example: 单词 diplomacy 的例句||||The talks have now gone into a stage of quiet diplomacy. 会谈现在已经进入了“温和外交”阶段。||||This was done through the skill in diplomacy. 这是通过外交手腕才做到的。

name: legacy
interpret: n.遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
example: 单词 legacy 的例句||||They are the most precious cultural legacy our forefathers left. 它们是我们祖先留下来的最宝贵的文化遗产。||||He thinks the legacy is a gift from the Gods. 他认为这笔遗产是天赐之物。

name: reassure
interpret: vt.使放心，使消除疑虑
example: 单词 reassure 的例句||||This seemed to reassure him and he continued more confidently. 这似乎使他放心一点，于是他更有信心地继续说了下去。||||The airline tried to reassure the customers that the planes were safe. 航空公司尽力让乘客相信飞机是安全的。

name: blur
interpret: n.模糊不清的事物；vt.使模糊，使看不清楚
example: 单词 blur 的例句||||The houses appeared as a blur in the mist. 房子在薄雾中隐隐约约看不清。||||If you move your eyes and your head, the picture will blur. 如果你的眼睛或头动了，图像就会变得模糊不清。

name: paralysis
interpret: n.麻痹(症)；瘫痪(症)
example: 单词 paralysis 的例句||||The paralysis affects his right leg and he can only walk with difficulty. 他右腿瘫痪步履维艰。||||An attack of paralysis seized him. 他突然瘫痪了。

name: victorious
interpret: adj.胜利的，得胜的
example: 单词 victorious 的例句||||We are certain to be victorious. 我们定会胜利。||||The victorious army returned in triumph. 获胜的部队凯旋而归。

name: glamour
interpret: n.魔力，魅力；vt.迷住
example: 单词 glamour 的例句||||Foreign travel has lost its glamour for her. 到国外旅行对她已失去吸引力了。||||The moonlight cast a glamour over the scene. 月光给景色增添了魅力。

name: beckon
interpret: vi.(以点头或打手势)向...示意，召唤；vt.召唤；吸引
example: 单词 beckon 的例句||||She crooked her finger to beckon him. 她勾勾手指向他示意。||||The wave for Hawaii beckon surfers from all around the world. 夏威夷的海浪吸引着世界各地的冲浪者前来。

name: chaotic
interpret: adj.混沌的，一片混乱的，一团糟的
example: 单词 chaotic 的例句||||Things have been getting chaotic in the office recently. 最近办公室的情况越来越乱了。||||The traffic in the city was chaotic. 这城市的交通糟透了。

name: sentimental
interpret: adj.多愁善感的，感伤的
example: 单词 sentimental 的例句||||She's a sentimental woman who believes marriage comes by destiny. 她是多愁善感的人，她相信姻缘命中注定。||||We were deeply touched by the sentimental movie. 我们深深被那感伤的电影所感动。

name: practitioner
interpret: n.实践者，从事者；(医生或律师等)开业者
example: 单词 practitioner 的例句||||He is an unqualified practitioner of law. 他是个无资格的律师。||||She was a medical practitioner before she entered politics. 从政前她是个开业医生。

name: overdue
interpret: adj.过期的，到期未付的；早该有的，迟到的
example: 单词 overdue 的例句||||The plane is overdue and has been delayed by the bad weather. 飞机晚点了，被坏天气耽搁了。||||The landlady is angry because the rent is overdue. 女房东生气了，因为房租过期未付。

name: blessing
interpret: n.祈神赐福；祷告；祝福，祝愿
example: 单词 blessing 的例句||||The blessing was said in Hebrew. 祷告用了希伯来语。||||A double blessing has descended upon the house. 双喜临门。

name: emulate
interpret: vt.努力赶上或超越，与…竞争；效仿；n.仿真，仿效
example: 单词 emulate 的例句||||You must work hard to emulate your sister. 你必须努力工作，赶上你姐姐。||||You must look at the film and try to emulate his behavior. 你们必须观看这部电影，并尽力模仿他的动作。

name: cliche
interpret: n./adj.陈词滥调(的)；老生常谈(的)；陈腐的
example: 单词 cliche 的例句||||You should always try to avoid the use of cliche. 你应该尽量避免使用陈词滥调。||||The old cliche is certainly true:the bigger car do mean bigger profits. 有句老话倒的确说得不假：车大利大。

name: banish
interpret: vt.放逐，驱逐；消除，排除
example: 单词 banish 的例句||||The doctor advised her to banish fear and anxiety. 医生劝她消除恐惧和忧虑。||||He tried to banish gloom from his thought. 他试图驱除心中的忧愁。

name: innate
interpret: adj.天生的，固有的，天赋的
example: 单词 innate 的例句||||You obviously have an innate talent for music. 你显然有天生的音乐才能。||||Correct ideas are not innate in the mind. 人的正确思想不是自己头脑中固有的。

name: calamity
interpret: n.灾害，祸患，不幸事件
example: 单词 calamity 的例句||||Even a greater natural calamity cannot daunt us. 再大的自然灾害也压不垮我们。||||The attack on Pearl Harbor was a crushing calamity. 偷袭珍珠港（对美军来说）是一场毁灭性的灾难。

name: scenario
interpret: n.剧本，脚本；概要
example: 单词 scenario 的例句||||But the birth scenario is not completely accurate. 然而分娩脚本并非完全准确的。||||This is a totally different scenario. 这是完全不同的剧本。

name: lament
interpret: n.悲叹，悔恨，恸哭；vi.哀悼，悔恨，悲叹；vt.哀悼；痛惜
example: 单词 lament 的例句||||Her face showed lament. 她的脸上露出悲伤的样子。|||| We lament the dead. 我们哀悼死者。

name: insomnia
interpret: n.失眠，失眠症
example: 单词 insomnia 的例句||||Worries and tenseness can lead to insomnia. 忧虑和紧张会导致失眠。||||He is suffering from insomnia. 他患失眠症。

name: shareholder
interpret: n.股东，股票持有人
example: 单词 shareholder 的例句||||The account department have prepare a financial statement for the shareholder. 财务部为股东准备了一份财务报表。||||A shareholder may transfer his shares in accordance with the law. 股东持有的股份可以依法转让。

name: speculation
interpret: n.思索，沉思；猜测；投机
example: 单词 speculation 的例句||||Her mind is occupied with speculation. 她的头脑忙于思考。||||There is widespread speculation that he is going to resign. 人们普遍推测他要辞职。

name: potent
interpret: adj.强有力的，有权势的；有效力的
example: 单词 potent 的例句||||The medicine had a potent effect on your disease. 这药物对你的病疗效很大。||||We must account of his potent influence. 我们必须考虑他的强有力的影响。

name: dispense
interpret: vt.分配，分发；配(药)，发(药)；实施；vi.免除，豁免
example: 单词 dispense 的例句||||Let us dispense the food. 咱们来分发这食物。||||The charity has been given a large sum of money to dispense as it sees fit. 这个慈善机构获得一大笔钱，可自行适当分配。

name: lapse
interpret: n.过失，流逝，失效，抛弃信仰，间隔；vi.堕落，停止，失效，流逝；vt.使失效
example: 单词 lapse 的例句||||The incident was being seen as a serious security lapse. 这一事故被看作是一次严重的安全疏忽。||||I had a lapse of memory. 我记错了。

name: gut
interpret: n.[pl.]胆量；内脏；adj.本能的；vt.取出内脏
example: 单词 gut 的例句||||It is not always necessary to gut the fish prior to freezing. 冷冻鱼之前并不总是需要先把内脏掏空。||||My immediate gut feeling was to refuse. 我本能的直接反应是拒绝。

name: democrat
interpret: n.民主主义者，民主人士；民主党党员
example: 单词 democrat 的例句||||The Democrat and the Public criticized each other. 民主党人和共和党人互相攻击。||||About two years later, he was defeated by Democrat Jimmy Carter. 大约两年后，他被民主党人杰米卡特击败。

name: payable
interpret: adj.可付的，应付的，有利益的
example: 单词 payable 的例句||||This check is payable on demand. 这是一张见票即付的支票。||||No tax is payable on these earnings. 这些收入不须交税。

name: soothe
interpret: vt.安慰；使平静；使减轻；缓和；奉承；vi.起抚慰作用
example: 单词 soothe 的例句||||I've managed to soothe him down a bit. 我想方设法使他平静了一点。||||This medicine should soothe your sore throat. 这种药会减轻你的喉痛。

name: recede
interpret: vi.退(去)，渐渐远去；向后倾斜，缩进
example: 单词 recede 的例句||||The colleges would recede in importance. 大学的重要性会降低。||||He saw that the dirty water had begun to recede. 他发现那污浊的水开始往下退了。

name: intrude
interpret: vi.闯入；侵入；打扰，侵扰
example: 单词 intrude 的例句||||I do not want to intrude if you are busy. 如果你忙我就不打扰你了。||||I don't want to intrude on your meeting. 我不想打扰你们的会议。

name: cocktail
interpret: n.鸡尾酒；餐前开胃小吃；混合物
example: 单词 cocktail 的例句||||We invited some foreign friends for a cocktail party. 我们邀请了一些外国朋友参加鸡尾酒会。||||At a cocktail party in Hollywood, I was introduced to Charlie Chaplin. 在好莱坞的一次鸡尾酒会上，人家把我介绍给查理·卓别林。

name: amiable
interpret: adj.和蔼可亲的，友善的，亲切的
example: 单词 amiable 的例句||||She was a very kind and amiable old woman. 她是个善良和气的老太太。||||We have a very amiable companionship. 我们之间存在一种友好的关系。

name: aspire
interpret: vi.(to，after)渴望，追求，有志于
example: 单词 aspire 的例句||||Living together with you is what I aspire toward in my life. 和你一起生活是我一生最大的愿望。||||I aspire to be an innovator not a follower. 我迫切希望能变成个开创者而不是跟随者。

name: reluctance
interpret: n.厌恶，讨厌，勉强，不情愿
example: 单词 reluctance 的例句||||The police released Andrew with reluctance. 警方勉强把安德鲁放走了。||||He showed the greatest reluctance to make a reply. 他表示很不愿意答复。

name: odds
interpret: n.让步，机率，可能性，比率；胜败优劣之别
example: 单词 odds 的例句||||The odds are 5 to 1 that she will win. 她获胜的机会是五比一。||||Do you know the odds of winning the lottery once? 你知道赢得一次彩票的几率多大吗？

name: hypocrisy
interpret: n.伪善，虚伪
example: 单词 hypocrisy 的例句||||He railed against hypocrisy and greed. 他痛斥伪善和贪婪的行为。||||He accused newspapers of hypocrisy in their treatment of the story. 他指责了报纸在报道该新闻时的虚伪。

name: toxic
interpret: adj.有毒的，因中毒引起的
example: 单词 toxic 的例句||||The factory had accidentally released a quantity of toxic waste into the sea. 这家工厂意外泄漏大量有毒废物到海中。||||There is a risk that toxic chemicals might be blasted into the atmosphere. 爆炸后有毒化学物质可能会进入大气层。

name: jargon
interpret: n.术语，行话
example: 单词 jargon 的例句||||They will not hear critics with their horrible jargon. 他们不愿意听到评论家们那些可怕的行话。||||It is important not to be overawed by the mathematical jargon. 要紧的是不要被数学的术语所吓倒.

name: gauge
interpret: vt.精确计量；估计；n.标准度量；计量器
example: 单词 gauge 的例句||||Can you gauge what her reaction is likely to be? 你能揣测她的反应可能是什么吗？||||It's difficult to gauge one's character. 要判断一个人的品格是很困难的。

name: unleash
interpret: vt.发泄，发出；解带子放开
example: 单词 unleash 的例句||||They hope to create allies to unleash against diseases, pests, and invasive species. 他们希望创造出一些新群体来对付疾病、害虫和一些有侵害性的物种。||||We need to unleash the pent up capital and creativity. 我们需要释放被压抑的资本和创造力。

name: eminent
interpret: adj.显赫的，杰出的，有名的，优良的
example: 单词 eminent 的例句||||We are expecting the arrival of an eminent scientist. 我们正期待一位著名科学家的来访。||||He is an eminent citizen of China. 他是一个杰出的中国公民。

name: rivalry
interpret: n.竞争，竞赛，对抗
example: 单词 rivalry 的例句||||The quarrel originated in rivalry between the two families. 这次争吵是两家不和引起的。||||He had a lot of rivalry with his brothers and sisters. 他和兄弟姐妹间经常较劲。

name: shriek
interpret: v./n.尖叫，叫喊
example: 单词 shriek 的例句||||Suddenly he began to shriek loudly. 突然他开始大声尖叫起来。||||People sometimes shriek because of terror, anger, or pain. 人们有时会因为恐惧，气愤或疼痛而尖叫。

name: affluent
interpret: adj.富裕的，富有的，丰富的，富饶的
example: 单词 affluent 的例句||||He hails from an affluent background. 他出身于一个富有的家庭。||||His parents were very affluent. 他的父母很富裕。

name: flirt
interpret: vi.调情，挑逗，调戏；vt.挥动；忽然弹出；n.调情者，卖俏者
example: 单词 flirt 的例句||||He used to flirt with every girl he met. 过去他总是看到一个姑娘便跟她调情。||||He watched the stranger flirt with his girlfriend and got fighting mad. 看着那个陌生人和他女朋友调情，他都要抓狂了。

name: statistical
interpret: adj.统计的，统计学的
example: 单词 statistical 的例句||||He showed the price fluctuations in a statistical table. 他用统计表显示价格的波动。||||They're making detailed statistical analysis. 他们正在做具体的统计分析。

name: swarm
interpret: n.(昆虫)等一大群；vi.成群飞舞；蜂拥而入
example: 单词 swarm 的例句||||There is a swarm of bees in the tree. 这树上有一窝蜜蜂。||||A swarm of ants are moving busily. 一群蚂蚁正在忙碌地搬家。

name: traitor
interpret: n.叛徒，卖国贼
example: 单词 traitor 的例句||||The traitor was finally found out and put in prison. 那个卖国贼终于被人发现并被监禁了起来。||||He was sold out by a traitor and arrested. 他被叛徒出卖而被捕了。

name: parasite
interpret: n.寄生虫；寄生菌；食客
example: 单词 parasite 的例句||||The lazy man was a parasite on his family. 那懒汉是家里的寄生虫。||||I don't want to be a parasite. I must earn my own way in life. 我不想做寄生虫，我要自己养活自己。

name: lure
interpret: n.吸引人的东西，诱惑物；vt.引诱，吸引
example: 单词 lure 的例句||||Life in big cities is a lure for many country boys. 大城市的生活吸引着许多乡下小伙子。||||He couldn't resist the lure of money. 他不能抵制金钱的诱惑。

name: evacuate
interpret: vt.&vi.遣送；搬空；抽出；排泄；大(小)便
example: 单词 evacuate 的例句||||We must evacuate those soldiers at once! 我们必须立即撤出这些士兵！|||They were planning to evacuate the seventy American officials still in the country. 他们正计划转移仍滞留在该国的70名美国官员。

name: fabulous
interpret: adj.极好的；极为巨大的；寓言中的，传说中的
example: 单词 fabulous 的例句||||We had a fabulous time at the party. 我们在晚会上玩得很痛快。||||This is a fabulous sum of money. 这是一笔巨款。

name: breach
interpret: n.违反，不履行；破裂；vt.冲破，攻破
example: 单词 breach 的例句||||We won't have any breach of discipline. 我们不允许任何破坏纪律的现象。||||He was sued for breach of contract. 他因不履行合同而被起诉。

name: cardinal
interpret: n.(天主教的)红衣主教；adj.首要的，基本的
example: 单词 cardinal 的例句||||This is a matter of cardinal significance. 这是非常重要的事。||||The Cardinal coloured with vexation. 红衣主教感到恼火，脸涨得通红。

name: pact
interpret: n.合同，条约，公约，协定
example: 单词 pact 的例句||||The two opposition parties made an electoral pact. 那两个反对党订了一个有关选举的协定。||||The trade pact between those two countries came to an end. 那两国的通商协定宣告结束。

name: monetary
interpret: adj.货币的，钱的；通货的；金融的；财政的
example: 单词 monetary 的例句||||The monetary system of some countries used to be based on gold. 过去有些国家的货币制度是金本位制的。||||Education in the wilderness is not a matter of monetary means. 荒凉地区的教育不是钱财问题。

name: prosecute
interpret: vt.告发；进行；vi.告发，起诉，作检察官
example: 单词 prosecute 的例句||||I am trying my best to prosecute my duties. 我正在尽力履行我的职责。||||Is there enough evidence to prosecute? 有没有起诉的足够证据？

name: precedent
interpret: n.先例，前例；惯例；adj.在前的，在先的
example: 单词 precedent 的例句||||Is there a precedent for what you want me to do? 你要我做的事有前例可援吗？||||This is a wonderful achievement without precedent in Chinese history. 这是中国历史上亘古未有的奇绩。

name: humiliate
interpret: vt.使羞辱，使丢脸[同]disgrace
example: 单词 humiliate 的例句||||What right had they to bully and humiliate people like this? 凭什么把人欺侮到这个地步呢？||||They pay me empty compliments which only humiliate me. 他们虚情假意地恭维我，这只能使我感到羞辱。

name: psychiatry
interpret: n.精神病学，精神病疗法
example: 单词 psychiatry 的例句||||The study appeared in the Amercian science Journal of Psychiatry. 这个研究发表在美国精神病学的杂志上。||||A physician is someone who specializes in psychiatry. 精神病专家是专门从事精神病治疗的人。

name: cohesive
interpret: adj.有粘着力的；有结合力的；凝聚性的
example: 单词 cohesive 的例句||||She sealed the parcel with cohesive tape. 她用粘胶带把包裹封起来。||||The author skillfully fuses these fragments into a cohesive whole. 作者将这些片断巧妙地结合成一个连贯的整体。

name: ebb
interpret: vi.衰退，减退；n.处于低潮，处于衰退状态
example: 单词 ebb 的例句||||The flood and ebb tides alternates with each other. 涨潮和落潮交替更迭。||||They swam till the tide began to ebb. 他们一直游到开始退潮。

name: chancellor
interpret: n.(英)大臣；法官；(德、奥)总理；大学校长
example: 单词 chancellor 的例句||||They submitted their reports to the Chancellor yesterday. 他们昨天向财政大臣递交了报告。||||He was regarded as the most successful Chancellor of modern times. 他被认为是现代最成功的财政大臣。

name: satire
interpret: n.讽刺，讽刺文学，讽刺作品
example: 单词 satire 的例句||||The movie is a clever satire on the advertising industry. 那部影片是关于广告业的一部巧妙的讽刺作品。||||Satire is often a form of protest against injustice. 讽刺往往是一种对不公正的抗议形式。

name: mischief
interpret: n.损害，伤害，危害；恶作剧，捣蛋，胡闹
example: 单词 mischief 的例句||||Nobody took notice of the mischief of the matter. 没有人注意到这件事情所带来的危害。||||He seems to intend mischief. 看来他想捣蛋。

name: panorama
interpret: n.全景，全景画，全景摄影，全景照片[装置]
example: 单词 panorama 的例句||||A vast panorama of the valley lay before us. 山谷的广阔全景展现在我们面前。||||A flourishing and prosperous panorama spread out before our eyes. 一派欣欣向荣的景象展现在我们的眼前。

name: obstruct
interpret: vt.&vi.阻隔，阻塞(道路、通道等)；n.阻碍物，障碍物
example: 单词 obstruct 的例句||||He became still more dissatisfied with it and secretly did everything in his power to obstruct it. 他对此更不满意，尽在暗里使绊子。||||The fallen trees obstruct the road. 倒下的树将路堵住了。

name: malignant
interpret: adj.恶性的，致命的；恶意的，恶毒的
example: 单词 malignant 的例句||||Alexander got a malignant slander. 亚历山大受到恶意的诽谤。||||He started to his feet with a malignant glance at Winston. 他爬了起来，不高兴地看了温斯顿一眼。

name: layoff
interpret: n.临时解雇，操作停止，活动停止期间，失业期
example: 单词 layoff 的例句||||Finally, prepare an explanation about what led to your layoff. 最后， 要准备好一套说辞来解释你被解雇的原因。||||Workers were re-employed after the layoff. 在暂时解雇不久后工人们又被再度雇用了。

name: kin
interpret: n.家族，亲属，血缘关系；adj.亲属关系的，同类的
example: 单词 kin 的例句||||He comes of good kin. 他出身好。||||She has gone to live with her husband's kin. 她住到丈夫的亲戚家里去了。

name: holder
interpret: n.持有者，占有者；(台，架等)支持物
example: 单词 holder 的例句||||The holder of the office of chairman is reponsible for arranging meetings. 担任主席职位的人负责安排会议。||||That runner is the holder of the world record for the hundred-yard dash. 那位运动员是一百码赛跑世界纪录的保持者。

name: hijack
interpret: vt.&vi.劫持，劫机，拦路抢劫
example: 单词 hijack 的例句||||Most countries refuse to give sanctuary to people who hijack aeroplanes. 大多数国家拒绝对劫机者提供庇护。||||The hijack take place just after the plane take off. 劫持是飞机刚起飞后发生的。

name: gallop
interpret: v./n.(马或骑马等)飞奔；飞速发展
example: 单词 gallop 的例句||||They are coming at a gallop towards us. 他们正朝着我们飞跑过来。||||The horse slowed to a walk after its long gallop. 那匹马跑了一大阵后慢下来缓步而行。

name: evade
interpret: vt.逃避，回避；避开，躲避
example: 单词 evade 的例句||||He tried to evade the embarrassing question. 他企图回避这令人难堪的问题。||||You are in charge of the job. How could you evade the issue? 你是负责人，你怎么能对这个问题不置可否？

name: clergy
interpret: n.[总称]牧师，神职人员
example: 单词 clergy 的例句||||I could heartily wish that more of our country clergy would follow this example. 我衷心希望，我国有更多的牧师效法这个榜样。||||All the local clergy attended the ceremony. 当地所有的牧师出席了仪式。

name: caress
interpret: vt./n.爱抚，抚摸
example: 单词 caress 的例句||||She gave the child a loving caress. 她疼爱地抚摸着孩子。||||She feasted on the caress of the hot spring. 她尽情享受着温泉的抚爱。

name: agitate
interpret: vi.(for,against)煽动，鼓动；vt.搅动
example: 单词 agitate 的例句||||They sent agents to agitate the local people. 他们派遣情报人员煽动当地的民众。||||All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush. 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻地搅动水。

name: acclaim
interpret: vt.向…欢呼，公认；vi.欢呼，喝彩；n.欢呼，喝彩，称赞
example: 单词 acclaim 的例句||||He was welcomed with great acclaim. 他受到十分热烈的欢迎。||||His achievements earned him the acclaim of the scientific community. 他的成就赢得了科学界的赞誉。

name: strenuous
interpret: adj.奋发的，使劲的；紧张的；热烈的，狂热的
example: 单词 strenuous 的例句||||He made strenuous efforts to improve his reading. 他奋发努力提高阅读能力。||||You may run yourself down in this strenuous week. 你可能会在这紧张的一周透支掉自己。

name: superfluous
interpret: adj.过多的，过剩的，多余的
example: 单词 superfluous 的例句||||She fined away superfluous matter in the design. 她删去了这图案中多余的东西。||||That request seemed superfluous when I wrote it. 我这样写的时候觉得这个请求似乎是多此一举。

name: statute
interpret: n.成文法，法令，法规；章程，规则，条例
example: 单词 statute 的例句||||Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute. 保障消费者利益已在法令里作了规定。||||The next section will consider this environmental statute in detail. 下一部分将详细论述环境法令的问题。

name: narrate
interpret: vt.讲，叙述；vi.叙述；讲述
example: 单词 narrate 的例句||||They each narrate their own tale but are all inextricably linked together. 她们各自讲述自己的故事，却又不可避免地联系在一起。||||He once holds the tear to narrate a such story to mine. 他曾经含着泪给我讲述了这样的一个故事。

name: inverse
interpret: adj.相反的，倒转的，反转的；n.相反之物；v.倒转
example: 单词 inverse 的例句||||Evil is the inverse of good. 恶是善的反面。||||When the direct approach failed he tried the inverse. 当直接方法失败时，他尝试相反的做法。

name: highland
interpret: n.(pl.)高地，山地
example: 单词 highland 的例句||||The highland game is part of Scotland's cultural heritage. 苏格兰高地游戏是苏格兰文化遗产的一部分。||||The highland forests where few hunters venture have long been the bear's sanctuary. 这片只有少数猎人涉险的高山森林，一直都是黑熊的避难所。

name: obstruction
interpret: n.阻塞，堵塞；障碍物
example: 单词 obstruction 的例句||||She was charged with obstruction of a police officer in the execution of his duty. 她被指控妨碍警察执行任务。||||The road was cleared from obstruction. 那条路已被清除了障碍。

name: conspiracy
interpret: n.阴谋，密谋，共谋
example: 单词 conspiracy 的例句||||The men were found guilty of conspiracy to murder. 这些人被裁决犯有阴谋杀人罪。||||He claimed that it was all a conspiracy against him. 他声称这一切都是一场针对他的阴谋。

name: abound
interpret: vi.大量存在；(in，with)充满，富于
example: 单词 abound 的例句||||Oranges abound here all the year round. 这里一年到头都有很多橙子。||||But problems abound in the management of State-owned companies. 但是在国有企业的管理中仍然存在不少问题。

name: capitalism
interpret: n.资本主义
example: 单词 capitalism 的例句||||The essence of his argument is that capitalism cannot succeed. 他的论点的核心是资本主义不能成功。||||Capitalism began to develop in Russia in the 19th century. 十九世纪资本主义在俄国开始发展。

name: dwelling
interpret: n.住宅，住所，寓所
example: 单词 dwelling 的例句||||Those two men are dwelling with us. 那两个人跟我们住在一起。||||He occupies a three-story dwelling place on the Park Street. 他在派克街上有一幢3层楼的寓所。

name: vigor
interpret: n.活力，精力，元气
example: 单词 vigor 的例句||||The choir sang the words out with great vigor. 合唱团以极大的热情唱出了歌词。||||She didn't want to be reminded of her beauty or her former vigor. 现在，她不愿人们提起她昔日的美丽和以前的精力充沛。

name: audit
interpret: vt.审计；查帐；核对；旁听；vi.审计；[审计] 查帐；n.审计；[审计] 查帐
example: 单词 audit 的例句||||Each year they audit our accounts and certify them as being true and fair. 他们每年对我们进行账务审核，以确保其真实无误。||||As usual, the yearly audit will take place in December. 跟往常一样，年度审计将在十二月份进行。

name: thrift
interpret: adj.节约，节俭；n.节俭，节约
example: 单词 thrift 的例句||||He has the virtues of thrift and hard work. 他具备节俭和勤奋的美德。||||His thrift and industry speak well for his future. 他的节俭和勤勉预示着他美好的未来。

name: aural
interpret: adj.听觉的，听力的
example: 单词 aural 的例句||||The opera was an aural as well as a visual delight. 这部歌剧对于听觉和视觉都是一种享受。||||You can use these tapes as aural material. 你可以把这些磁带当作听力材料。

name: apparatus
interpret: n.装置，器械；器具，设备
example: 单词 apparatus 的例句||||The school's audio apparatus includes films and records. 学校的视听设备包括放映机和录音机。||||They had a very refined apparatus. 他们有一套非常精良的设备。

name: zeal
interpret: n.热心，热情，热忱
example: 单词 zeal 的例句||||Revolutionary zeal caught them up, and they joined the army. 革命热情激励他们，于是他们从军了。||||They worked with great zeal to finish the project. 他们热情高涨地工作，以期完成这个项目。

name: bosom
interpret: n.胸，胸部；胸怀；内心；adj.亲密的
example: 单词 bosom 的例句||||She drew a little book from her bosom. 她从怀里取出一本小册子。||||A dark jealousy stirred in his bosom. 他内心生出一阵恶毒的嫉妒。

name: brook
interpret: n.小河，溪；vt.忍受，容让
example: 单词 brook 的例句||||In our room we could hear the murmur of a distant brook. 在我们房间能听到远处小溪汩汩的流水声。||||The brook trickled through the valley. 小溪涓涓流过峡谷。

name: conversion
interpret: n.转化，转换，转变
example: 单词 conversion 的例句||||He underwent quite a conversion. 他彻底变了。||||Waste conversion is a part of the production process. 废物处理是生产过程的一个组成部分。

name: lumber
interpret: n.木材，木料；vi.以破旧东西堆满；伐木；笨重移动；vt.砍伐木材；乱堆
example: 单词 lumber 的例句||||The truck was sent to carry lumber. 卡车被派出去运木材。||||They slapped together a cabin out of old lumber. 他们利用旧木料草草地盖起了一间小屋。

name: overtime
interpret: adj.超时的，加班的；adv.加班地
example: 单词 overtime 的例句||||They are working overtime to finish the work. 为了完成任务他们正在加班加点地工作。||||He was paid for the overtime he worked. 他领到了加班费。

name: orphan
interpret: n.孤儿；adj.无父母的
example: 单词 orphan 的例句||||He brought up the orphan and passed onto him his knowledge of medicine. 他把一个孤儿养大，并且把自己的医术传给了他。||||The orphan had been reared in a convent by some good sisters. 这个孤儿在一所修道院里被几个好心的修女带大。

name: pebble
interpret: n.卵石，小圆石
example: 单词 pebble 的例句||||The bird mistook the pebble for egg and tried to hatch it. 这只鸟错把卵石当蛋，想去孵它。||||The pebble made a ripple on the surface of the lake. 石子在湖面上激起一个涟漪。

name: rein
interpret: n.疆绳，统治，支配；vt.以僵绳控制，统治
example: 单词 rein 的例句||||The horse answered to the slightest pull on the rein. 只要缰绳轻轻一拉，马就作出反应。||||He never drew rein for a moment till he reached the river. 他一刻不停地一直跑到河边。

name: recollect
interpret: v.回忆，想起，记起，忆起，记得
example: 单词 recollect 的例句||||He tried to recollect things and drown himself in them. 他极力回想过去的事情而沉浸于回忆之中。||||She could not recollect being there. 她回想不起曾经到过那儿。

name: rotary
interpret: adj.(运动等)旋转的；轮转的；转动的
example: 单词 rotary 的例句||||The central unit is a rotary drum. 核心设备是一个旋转的滚筒。||||A rotary table helps to optimize the beam incidence angle. 一张旋转的桌子有助于将光线影响之方式最佳化。

name: confide
interpret: vt.向某人吐露秘密；vi.信赖；吐露秘密
example: 单词 confide 的例句||||I would never readily confide in anybody. 我从不轻易向人吐露秘密。||||He is going to confide the secrets of his heart to us. 他将向我们吐露他心里的秘密。

name: endorse
interpret: vt.(支票、汇票等)背书，背署；批注；同意；赞同
example: 单词 endorse 的例句||||No one is foolish enough to endorse it. 没有哪个人会傻得赞成它。||||I fully endorse your opinions on this subject. 我完全拥护你对此课题的主张。

name: insufficient
interpret: adj.(for，of)不足的，不够的
example: 单词 insufficient 的例句||||There was insufficient evidence to convict him. 没有足够证据给他定罪。||||In their day scientific knowledge was insufficient to settle the matter. 在他们的时代，科学知识还不能足以解决这些问题。

name: torrent
interpret: n.激流，洪流；爆发，(话语等的)连发
example: 单词 torrent 的例句||||The torrent scoured a channel down the hillside. 急流沿着山坡冲出了一条沟。||||Her pent-up anger was released in a torrent of words. 她压抑的愤怒以滔滔不绝的话爆发了出来。

name: anguish
interpret: n.(尤指心灵上的)极度痛苦，烦恼
example: 单词 anguish 的例句||||She cried out for anguish at parting. 分手时，她由于痛苦而失声大哭。||||The unspeakable anguish wrung his heart. 难言的痛苦折磨着他的心。

name: plight
interpret: n.困境，境况，誓约，艰难；vt.宣誓，保证，约定
example: 单词 plight 的例句||||The leader was much concerned over the plight of the refugees. 那位领袖对难民的困境很担忧。||||She was in a most helpless plight. 她真不知如何是好。

name: underlie
interpret: vt.位于...之下，成为...的基础
example: 单词 underlie 的例句||||Technology improvements underlie these trends. 科技进步将成为此发展趋势的基础。||||Many facts underlie my decision. 我的决定是以许多事实为依据的。

name: vibration
interpret: n.颤动，振动；摆动
example: 单词 vibration 的例句||||There is so much vibration on a ship that one cannot write. 船上的震动大得使人无法书写。||||The vibration of the window woke me up. 窗子的震动把我惊醒了。

name: tangible
interpret: adj.有形的，可触摸的，确凿的，实际的
example: 单词 tangible 的例句||||The policy has not yet brought any tangible benefits. 这项政策还没有带来任何实质性的好处。||||There is no tangible proof. 没有确凿的证据。

name: squad
interpret: n.班，小队，小团体；vt.把…编成班或小组
example: 单词 squad 的例句||||The squad leader ordered the men to mark time. 班长命令战士们原地踏步。||||A squad is the smallest unit in an army. 班是军队的最小构成单位。

name: lash
interpret: vt.系牢；鞭打；猛烈抨击；vi.鞭打；猛击；急速甩动；n.鞭打；眼睫毛
example: 单词 lash 的例句||||He received a lash of her hand on his cheek. 他突然被她打了一记耳光。||||With a lash of its tail the tiger leaped at her. 老虎把尾巴一甩朝她扑过来。

name: inefficient
interpret: adj.效率低的，无效的
example: 单词 inefficient 的例句||||The inefficient operation cost the firm a lot of money. 低效率的运作使该公司损失了许多钱。||||Their communication systems are inefficient in the extreme. 他们的通讯系统效率非常差。

name: gush
interpret: v.喷，涌；滔滔不绝(说话)；n.喷，涌流；迸发
example: 单词 gush 的例句||||There was a gush of blood from the wound. 血从伤口流出。||||There was a gush of blood as the arrow was pulled out from the arm. 当从手臂上拔出箭来时，一股鲜血涌了出来。

name: esteem
interpret: n.尊敬，尊重；vt.尊重，敬重；把…看作
example: 单词 esteem 的例句||||I did not esteem him to be worthy of trust. 我认为他不值得信赖。||||The veteran worker ranks high in public love and esteem. 那位老工人深受大伙的爱戴。

name: converse
interpret: vi.谈话，谈天，闲聊；adv.相反的，相反
example: 单词 converse 的例句||||He can converse in three languages. 他可以用3种语言谈话。||||I wanted to appear friendly and approachable but I think I gave the converse impression. 我想显得友好、平易近人些，却发觉给人的印象恰恰相反。

name: afterward
interpret: adv.后来；以后
example: 单词 afterward 的例句||||Let's go to the theatre first and eat afterward. 让我们先去看戏，然后吃饭。||||Afterward, the boy became a very famous artist. 后来，这男孩成为一个很有名的艺术家。

name: awe
interpret: n.敬畏，惊惧；vt.使敬畏，使惊惧
example: 单词 awe 的例句||||The sight filled us with awe. 这景色使我们大为惊叹。||||The approaching tornado struck awe in our hearts. 正在逼近的龙卷风使我们惊恐万分。

name: intervention
interpret: n.介入，干涉，干预
example: 单词 intervention 的例句||||The government's intervention in this dispute will not help. 政府对这场争论的干预不会起作用。||||Many people felt he would be hostile to the idea of foreign intervention. 许多人觉得他会反对外来干预。

name: defer
interpret: vt.推迟，拖延；vi.(to)遵从，听从，服从
example: 单词 defer 的例句||||We wish to defer our decision until next week. 我们希望推迟到下星期再作出决定。||||We will defer to whatever the committee decides. 我们遵从委员会作出的任何决定。

name: definitive
interpret: adj.确切的，权威性的；最后的，决定性的
example: 单词 definitive 的例句||||This book is the definitive guide to world cuisine. 这本书是世界美食的权威指南。||||No one has come up with a definitive answer as to why this should be so. 至于为什么该这样，还没有人给出明确的答复。

name: curb
interpret: n.场外证券市场，场外交易；vt.制止，抑制
example: 单词 curb 的例句||||I could not curb my anger. 我按捺不住我的愤怒。||||You must curb your daughter when you are in church. 你在教堂时必须管住你的女儿。

name: consecutive
interpret: adj.连续的，联贯的，始终一贯的
example: 单词 consecutive 的例句||||It has rained for four consecutive days. 已连续下了四天雨。||||The policy of our Party is consecutive. 我党的政策始终如一。

name: dubious
interpret: adj.怀疑的，无把握的；有问题的，靠不住的
example: 单词 dubious 的例句||||What he said yesterday was dubious. 他昨天说的话很含糊。||||He uses some dubious shifts to get money. 他用一些可疑的手段去赚钱。

name: esthetic
interpret: adj.美学的，审美的；悦目的，雅致的
example: 单词 esthetic 的例句||||That armchair is comfortable but not very esthetic. 那张扶手椅坐起来舒服，但不太美观。||||There are physical distance and esthetic distance between the esthetic subject and the object. 审美的主客体之间有物理距离和心理距离。

name: intelligible
interpret: adj.可理解的，明白易懂的，清楚的
example: 单词 intelligible 的例句||||This report would be intelligible only to an expert in computing. 只有计算机运算专家才能看懂这份报告。||||His argument was barely intelligible. 他的论点不易理解。

name: intensify
interpret: vt.加强；变强；加剧
example: 单词 intensify 的例句||||We must intensify our educational work among our own troops. 我们必须加强自己部队的教育工作。||||They were ordered to intensify their patrols to protect our air space. 他们奉命加强巡逻，保卫我国的领空。

name: portray
interpret: vt.描写，描述；画(人物、景象等)
example: 单词 portray 的例句||||It is difficult to portray feelings in words. 感情很难用言语来描写。||||Can you portray the best and worst aspects of this job? 您能描述一下这份工作最好与最坏的方面吗？

name: interim
interpret: adj.暂时的，临时的；n.间歇，过渡期间
example: 单词 interim 的例句||||The government is taking interim measures to help those in immediate need. 政府正在采取临时措施帮助那些有立即需要的人。||||It may turn out to be an interim technology. 这可能只是个过渡技术。

name: expend
interpret: vt.花费，消费，消耗
example: 单词 expend 的例句||||Don't expend all your time on such a useless job. 不要把时间消耗在这种无用的工作上。||||They expend all their strength in trying to climb out. 他们费尽全力想爬出来。

name: intermittent
interpret: adj.间歇的，断断续续的
example: 单词 intermittent 的例句||||Did you hear the intermittent sound outside? 你听见外面时断时续的声音了吗？|||In the daytime intermittent rains freshened all the earth. 白天里，时断时续地下着雨，使整个大地都生气勃勃了。

name: intimidate
interpret: vt.恐吓，威胁
example: 单词 intimidate 的例句||||You think you can intimidate people into doing what you want? 你以为你可以威胁别人做任何事？||||The first strike capacity is intended mainly to intimidate adversary. 第一次攻击的武力主要是用来吓阻敌方的。

name: exquisite
interpret: adj.精美的；敏锐的；剧烈的，感觉强烈的
example: 单词 exquisite 的例句||||I was admiring the exquisite workmanship in the mosaic. 我当时正在欣赏镶嵌画的精致做工。||||I still remember the exquisite pleasure I experienced in Bali. 我依然记得在巴厘岛所经历的那种剧烈的快感。

name: intrigue
interpret: vt.激起兴趣，迷住；vi.耍阴谋；n.阴谋，密谋
example: 单词 intrigue 的例句||||Court officials will intrigue against the royal family. 法院官员将密谋反对皇室。||||The royal palace was filled with intrigue. 皇宫中充满了勾心斗角。

name: precipitate
interpret: adj.突如其来的；vt.使突然发生；n.沉淀物
example: 单词 precipitate 的例句||||I don't think we should make precipitate decisions. 我认为我们不应该贸然作出决定。||||The king was too precipitate in declaring war. 国王在宣战一事上过于轻率。

name: preclude
interpret: vt.阻止，排除，防止；妨碍
example: 单词 preclude 的例句||||We try to preclude any possibility of misunderstanding. 我们努力排除任何误解的可能性。||||My present finances preclude the possibility of buying a car. 按我目前的财务状况我是不可能买车的。

name: premature
interpret: adj.比预期时间早的；不成熟的，仓促的
example: 单词 premature 的例句||||It is yet premature to predict the possible outcome of the dialogue. 预言这次对话可能有什么结果为时尚早。||||The premature baby is doing well. 那个早产的婴儿很健康。

name: premise
interpret: n.前提；vt.提论，预述；vi.作出前提
example: 单词 premise 的例句||||Let me premise my argument with a bit of history. 让我引述一些史实作为我立论的前提。||||We can deduce a conclusion from the premise. 我们可以从这个前提推出结论。

name: premium
interpret: n.加付款；赠品；adj.高级的；售价高的
example: 单词 premium 的例句||||You have to pay a premium for express delivery. 寄快递你得付额外费用。||||Fresh water was at a premium after the reservoir was contaminated. 在水库被污染之后，清水便因稀而贵了。

name: invert
interpret: vt.使反转，使颠倒，使转化
example: 单词 invert 的例句||||She catch the insect by invert her cup over it. 她把杯子倒扣在昆虫上，将它逮住了。||||Invert the cake onto a cooling rack. 把蛋糕倒扣在冷却架上。

name: irony
interpret: n.反语，冷嘲；具有讽刺意味的事，嘲弄
example: 单词 irony 的例句||||She said to him with slight irony. 她略带嘲讽地对他说。||||In her voice we could sense a certain tinge of irony. 从她的声音里我们可以感到某种讥讽的意味。
